0.title: Vishal Bhardwaj's film 'Khufiya' is not a regular spy thriller: Tabu
0.article_body: Speaking about working with filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj in 'Khufiya', actress Tabu said the film is Vishal's dear project, which was conceptualised long back but couldn't happen. "Then...pandemic happened, which is when it picked up again. We were casting for it during COVID-19. It's the world of intelligence [and] agents...but not like...regular spy thriller that [people have seen]," she added.

1.title: Kerala CM must reveal his income sources: BJP leader amid gold scam
1.article_body: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan said CM Pinarayi Vijayan must reveal the sources of wealth accumulated by himself and his family members. His comment comes after the main accused in Kerala gold smuggling case alleged CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife and daughter's involvement in the case. "The CM has to explain each detail of the allegations...against him," Radhakrishnan added.

2.title: PM Modi has brought a new culture to political working: Nadda in WB
2.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda, who is on a two-day visit to West Bengal, said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has brought a new culture to political working in the country. Criticising the ruling party TMC, Nadda said, "Condition of West Bengal right now is similar to what India was famous for several years ago, scams and corruption."

3.title: 3 arrested for murder of elderly couple in Kolkata
3.article_body: The Kolkata Police have arrested three persons in connection with the murder of an elderly couple, whose bodies were found on Monday in their house in Kolkata's Bhowanipore area, police said. "It was a pre-planned murder," Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Kumar Goyal said. "The mastermind, who is a distant relative of the couple, is still absconding," Goyal added.

4.title: Don't arm demilitarised islands: Turkish Prez Erdoğan tells Greece
4.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has told Greece to demilitarise islands in Aegean Sea, which Turkey claims are being armed in violation of treaties that guarantee islands' unarmed status. Turkey further states that islands were ceded to Greece on the condition that they won't be militarised. Turkey recently halted bilateral talks with Greece, which began in 2021 after five-year hiatus.

5.title: Mumbai records 1,702 new COVID-19 cases; positivity rate at 9.64%
5.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,702 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday, 63 less than the 1,765 new infections reported on Wednesday. With 7,998 active cases, the city's positivity rate stands at 9.64% while its recovery rate has dipped to 97%. Mumbai's total caseload rose to 10,75,243 while its death toll rose to 19,570 as one patient succumbed to the virus on Thursday.

6.title: 5 killed, 3 injured as vehicle falls into gorge in U'khand
6.article_body: Five people were killed and three injured after their vehicle fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Tehri district on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred around 2:45 pm when the vehicle was on its way to Saud village, Ghansali Police Station in-charge Sukhpal Singh Mann said. Police, SDRF personnel retrieved the bodies with the help of locals, the SHO said.

7.title: Congress leader confuses Goddess Sita with Draupadi, says 'cheerharan of Sita Maiya'
7.article_body: During a press conference, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala confused Goddess Sita with Draupadi and said, "BJP wants to do cheerharan of democracy, just like cheerharan of Sita Maiya. But they'll lose [in Rajya Sabha polls]." Criticising Surjewala for the error, BJP's Shehzad Poonawala said, "You can wear Janeu on the coat but what's inside you will always come out!"

8.title: Rahul Gandhi to appear before ED on June 13, Cong plans protest
8.article_body: Congress will hold protests on June 13 when party leader Rahul Gandhi will appear before the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. Congress called the case a "political vendetta", adding that the case has no grounds for investigation. ED questioned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge and Congress Treasurer Pawan Bansal in April this year in New Delhi.

9.title: CRED raises $80 mn in Series F funding at $6.5 bn valuation: Report
9.article_body: Fintech unicorn CRED has raised $80 million (₹617 crore) of fresh capital in its Series F funding round at a valuation of $6.5 billion, Entrackr reported. According to a regulatory filing with the Registrar of Companies, CRED approved issuance of 42,308 Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares at a price of ₹1,45,846.98. CRED's current valuation has risen 60% from $4.01 billion.

10.title: NASA to launch study into unexplained aerial phenomena
10.article_body: NASA will host a media teleconference at 1 pm EDT (10:30 pm IST) on Thursday to discuss a new team it is commissioning to examine unidentified aerial phenomena (UAPs). This comes after years of speculation about events in the sky that cannot be identified as aircraft or known natural phenomena. "There's no evidence UAPs are extra-terrestrial in origin," NASA stated.

11.title: India record their highest T20I total against South Africa
11.article_body: India on Thursday recorded their highest T20I total against South Africa after registering 211/4 in their 20 overs in the first T20I in Delhi. Ishan Kishan top-scored for India with 76 runs off 48 deliveries. India's previous highest T20I total against South Africa had come on February 18, 2018, when they recorded 203/5 in Johannesburg.

12.title: You're such an inspiration: Soni on Mahima Chaudhry's battle with cancer
12.article_body: After actor Anupam Kher shared actress Mahima Chaudhry's video where she revealed that she battled cancer, actress Soni Razdan reacted to the same. Taking to Instagram, Soni wrote, "Wow what an empowering story and thank you Anupam and Mahima for letting us hear this. Lots of love and good health to you. You're such an inspiration @mahimachaudhry1."

13.title: Let this love also be seen off-camera: Govinda on Krushna breaking down while apologising
13.article_body: Govinda, in an appearance on Maniesh Paul's podcast, responded to his estranged nephew Krushna's apology.  When Maniesh told him that Krushna was apologetic on the show and that he loves him, Govinda replied, "Then let the love be seen off-camera too." Krushna broke down on the show and said he misses his uncle "a lot".

14.title: List of cities with highest maximum temperature on Thursday released
14.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that reported maximum temperature of 45°C or more on Thursday. Haryana's Faridabad reported the highest maximum temperature of 47.1°C, followed by 47°C in Rajasthan's Ganganagar. Delhi's Mungeshpur and Punjab's Bathinda recorded maximum temperature of 46.8°C. Baloda Bazaar recorded 46.4°C as maximum temperature while Mewat recorded 46.3°C.

15.title: Mira Rajput supports Vidya Balan & Shefali Shah for calling out sexism at home
15.article_body: In an interview, actresses Vidya Balan and Shefali Shah spoke about the double standards toward men and women that are practised in every home. Actor Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput supported Vidya and Shefali's remarks and said a woman's work deserves respect. Vidya had said in the interview, "Domestic workers don't mind interrupting me but they mind interrupting Siddharth (husband)."

16.title: Satyendar Jain is suffering from post-COVID sleep apnea: Lawyer
16.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain, who is in Enforcement Directorate's (ED) custody for alleged money laundering, is suffering from post-COVID sleep apnea, his lawyer said. "When [Jain] came out of...court, he wasn't feeling well and was later sent to...hospital," advocate Rishikesh Kumar said. Jain will be under ED's custody till June 13, a Delhi court ruled earlier today.

17.title: Iran deletes its statement on discussing Prophet remark with NSA Ajit Doval
17.article_body: Iran has pulled down its readout, wherein it stated that Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian raised concerns about remarks against Prophet Muhammad in his meeting with NSA Ajit Doval. The readout had stated that Doval had assured action. However, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson refused to comment on their meeting and pointed out that Iran's statement has been deleted.

18.title: Go protest in Delhi: Mamata to Nupur Sharma hate speech protesters
18.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday asked protesters protesting against the remarks of BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal to take their demonstrations to New Delhi. The speech of the BJP leaders has damaged the image of India across the world and they should be arrested, Banerjee told reporters.

19.title: 6-yr-old girl killed in a leopard attack in MP's Mhow
19.article_body: A six-year-old girl was killed in a leopard attack at a village in Madhya Pradesh's Mhow in the early hours of Thursday, an official said. The incident took place when the girl, Ravina Wasnik, was sleeping with her parents outside their house, Choral forest range officer Rahul Jain said. The leopard escaped when the parents raised an alarm, he added.

20.title: Which players have captained India in T20I cricket?
20.article_body: Rishabh Pant today became the eighth player to lead India in T20Is. Virender Sehwag had captained India in their first-ever T20I match in 2006. MS Dhoni captained India in most T20Is (72), while Virat Kohli captained in 50 T20Is. Rohit Sharma has led India in 28 T20Is so far. Suresh Raina, Ajinkya Rahane and Shikhar Dhawan have also captained India.

21.title: Twitter agrees to share data on bots after Musk threatens to terminate $44bn deal: Report
21.article_body: Twitter will yield to Elon Musk's demand for internal data, the Washington Post reported. This comes days after Musk threatened to terminate his $44 billion deal to purchase Twitter, accusing it of failing to provide data on fake accounts. The report cited a source as saying that Twitter's board decided to let Musk access its full "firehose" of internal data.

22.title: Will hit the streets if textbook revisions not rolled back in K'taka: Cong
22.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah said that his party will take the protest to the streets if the state government does not roll back revised school textbooks. He added that this has hurt the sentiments of Kannadigas. Siddaramaiah said, "The textbook has been revised by Rohith Chakrathirtha (head of the textbook revision committee), who is an orthodox RSS man."

23.title: South Africa batter Aiden Markram tests positive for coronavirus in India
23.article_body: South Africa batter Aiden Markram, who is a part of the Proteas' squad for the five-match T20I series against India, has tested positive for coronavirus. South Africa captain Temba Bavuma revealed the development at the toss ahead of the first T20I. Markram, who was originally scheduled to play the first T20I, has been replaced by debutant Tristan Stubbs.

24.title: 5 arrested for selling land using fake papers in Bengaluru
24.article_body: Five persons were arrested for allegedly creating fake documents for a site in Bengaluru's Vidyaranyapura and selling it to third party without the owner's knowledge, police said. The site belonged to Karthik BS, who is settled in Kuwait. One of the accused noticed that a site had been lying vacant and teamed up with others to sell it, police added.

25.title: 81% COVID-19 cases reported in 4 states/UTs in the last 24 hours: Govt
25.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in India, the Centre on Thursday said that 81% cases in the last 24 hours have been reported in Maharashtra, Kerala, Delhi and Karnataka (in descending order of number of new cases reported). India reported a total of 7,240 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. The government asked the states not to lower their guard.

26.title: People want to pull you down: Govinda on film industry turning against him
26.article_body: When asked if he feels bad when the film industry accuses him of being unprofessional and tardy, actor Govinda said, "When you're successful, there are many who'll try to pull you down." "When I was at the peak for 14-15 years, when everything was going in my favour, nobody raised...issues...This is...film industry, people change with time," he added.

27.title: Delhi records 622 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, positivity rate at 3.17%
27.article_body: Delhi on Thursday reported 622 new COVID-19 cases, with its positivity rate rising to 3.17% compared with 2.84% on Wednesday. The national capital reported two deaths with 1,072 patients in home isolation. A total of 20,885 beneficiaries were vaccinated in the last 24 hours, with 2,450 beneficiaries being administered the first dose and 7,431 beneficiaries being administered the second dose.

28.title: Ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh is nothing: Father of man killed in J&K
28.article_body: The father of Rahul Bhat, a government employee who was killed by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam on May 12, has said that the ex-gratia amount of ₹5 lakh received by the family is "nothing". "Don't treat us like beggars. My son was killed...on duty," Bittuji Bhat said. He further demanded that government should initiate inquiry on Rahul's murder.

29.title: UP Police takes action against over 1.29 lakh illegal loudspeakers
29.article_body: Following directions from the Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government, UP Police have taken action against over 1.29 lakh loudspeakers across the state. Over 72,500 loudspeakers have been removed from various religious places while the sound level of 56,558 loudspeakers was reduced and brought down to the level of standard parameters, according to reports.

30.title: Monitoring developments: India as US General calls Chinese activity near Ladakh 'alarming'
30.article_body: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday said, "The government carefully monitors development along our border areas including construction of infrastructure by Chinese side in Western sector." He added that it took all adequate measures to safeguard territorial integrity. This comes after a US General called the buildup of Chinese infrastructure near Ladakh "alarming".

31.title: India reacts to vandalisation of Hindu temple in Pak, says 'we've conveyed our protest'
31.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday said that it has noted the recent incident of vandalisation of a Hindu temple in Pakistan's Karachi. "We believe it's another act of systemic persecution of religious minorities. We've conveyed our protest to Pakistan government, urging them to ensure safety, security and well-being of its minority communities," it added.

32.title: Making phone calls to Putin is like talking to Hitler: Poland Prez
32.article_body: Poland's President Andrzej Duda has reportedly criticised leaders of France and Germany for their telephonic conversations with Russian President Vladimir Putin and compared it to conversing with Adolf Hitler during World War II. Duda added that there's no evidence that conversations had led to peace process amid Russia-Ukraine war. Poland has taken in over 3 million Ukrainian refugees since war.

33.title: Over 200 cases of call centres extorting money reported in Gurugram
33.article_body: Gurugram Police said it has received over 200 complaints of bogus call centres that allegedly extort money from their targets on the pretext of recovering loans since December 2021. Most victims targeted are those who took loans through Chinese applications and defaulted on payments. The call centres' employees are given 25% of the money they extort, said ACP Indiwar.

34.title: India's playing XI for 1st T20I against South Africa announced
34.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the first T20I in Delhi on Thursday. India are being led by Rishabh Pant for the first time. Ishan Kishan and Ruturaj Gaikwad will open the batting for India. Meanwhile, Dinesh Karthik is playing an international match after nearly three years.

35.title: IndiGo staff member was rude, used arrogant & threatening tone with us: Pooja Hegde
35.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde took to Twitter on Thursday to share her experience with a staff member of IndiGo airline. "Extremely sad with how rude @IndiGo6E staff member, by the name of Vipul Nakashe behaved with us today on our flight out from Mumbai," she wrote. "Absolutely arrogant, ignorant and threatening tone used with us for no reason," Pooja added.

36.title: Madhavan, Nambi Narayanan meet Sunita Williams as they promote Rocketry in USA
36.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, who is promoting his directorial debut project Rocketry: The Nambi Effect, recently met astronaut Sunita Williams in the USA. The actor is on a 12-day promotional tour in US, after his visit to Cannes 2022. Former ISRO scientist Nambi Narayanan, on whose life the film has been made, also joined Madhavan as they visited Stafford, Texas recently.

37.title: Nearly 70 arrested for smuggling liquor from Delhi to UP since April 1
37.article_body: Nearly 70 people have been arrested for smuggling liquor from Delhi to Uttar Pradesh since April 1 due to heavy discounts on liquor purchases in Delhi, an excise official said. Excise officials have seized over 10,000 litres of illicit liquor and impounded over 20 vehicles. "The activity dents UP's revenue earnings," said Gautam Buddha Nagar's Excise Officer RB Singh.

38.title: When I talk, 25 BJP leaders bark like Mudhol dogs: Siddaramaiah
38.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah sparked a controversy when he compared BJP leaders to Mudhol (hound) dogs. "When I talk individually, 25 people from BJP start barking against me like Mudhol dogs. But when they bark, only I have to speak, no one else from our party speaks," he said, speaking at an event in Mysuru on Wednesday.

39.title: 3 history-sheeters held for attacking police with knife in Mumbai
39.article_body: Three history-sheeters were arrested for allegedly attacking two policemen with a knife when they tried to prevent a vehicle theft in Mumbai's Vikhroli, an official said. The constables were attacked by two bike-borne men when they tried to intercept the stolen vehicle. The accused were arrested within 12 hours of the attack, the official said.

40.title: Govt officer's house in Guj robbed, 2 held hostage at gunpoint
40.article_body: Three men broke into a government official's house in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Wednesday afternoon, held her house help and maid hostage at gunpoint and escaped with cash and valuables worth ₹1.6 lakh. In her complaint, Alpana Dani stated that upon returning from a parlour, she heard cries for help from her house, which was locked from the inside.

41.title: Flood sensors installed in 10 flood-prone areas in Kalyan-Dombivli
41.article_body: The Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) has installed flood sensors at 10 flood-prone locations, officials said. "These sensors will work prior to the flooding based on the level of water and then send an alert," a Smart Kalyan Dombivli Corporation Limited (SKDCL) official said. These sensors have been installed as Kalyan-Dombivli faced heavy flooding during past monsoons.

42.title: Arrest 'disastrous BJP leaders': Mamata on Prophet remarks row
42.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday reacted to the alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad by "disastrous BJP leaders", ex-party spokesperson Nupur Sharma and ex-Delhi BJP media chief Naveen Kumar Jindal, terming them as "hate speech". "I strongly seek that the accused leaders of BJP be arrested immediately so that the unity of the country isn't disturbed," she said.

43.title: Woman, 3 & 6 yr-old daughters physically assaulted in Delhi; 1 dead
43.article_body: A woman, along with her two daughters, aged three and six, were found severely beaten up at their house in Delhi's Prem Nagar on Wednesday. The six-year-old later died in a hospital, police said. An FIR under sections 307 of the IPC (attempt to murder) and 302 (murder) was filed, according to DCP (Rohini) Pranav Tayal.

44.title: Biggest protest in Pakistan's history within next few days: Imran Khan
44.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that he would finalise the date for the "biggest protest in Pakistan's history" within the next few days. "We have to go all-in for our campaign for true freedom in the next phase," he added. Following his ouster from power, Khan has been holding several rallies, demanding early elections in the country.

45.title: SRK attends Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan's wedding in Chennai, pics surface
45.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan attended his 'Jawan' co-star Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan's wedding in Chennai after recently recovering from COVID-19. The actor's manager Pooja Dadlani shared pictures of him at the wedding venue on her Instagram profile on Thursday morning and captioned it, "For Nayanthara's Special Day." Filmmaker Atlee also shared a picture of himself with Shah Rukh and his manager.

46.title: 10,000 people stuck in Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk: Mayor amid war
46.article_body: Amid ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, Sievierodonetsk's Mayor Oleksandr Stryuk said on Thursday that it's impossible to evacuate people from the city, adding that about 10,000 civilians are stuck there. Stryuk, however, stated that Ukrainian forces still control industrial zone and adjacent areas. Russian military has focused its offensive in Sievierodonetsk, which is a part of Donbas region.

47.title: Won’t be intimidated by these tactics: Owaisi on Delhi Police’s FIR
47.article_body: After Delhi Police named AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand in an FIR registered over alleged inflammatory remarks, Owaisi said FIR doesn’t specify his crime. "We'll not be intimidated by these tactics. Criticising hate speech and giving hate speeches cannot be equated," Owaisi added. "I don’t know which specific remarks of mine have attracted FIR," Owaisi stated.

48.title: Reliance, Apollo make $6.3 bn joint bid for drugstore chain Boots: Report
48.article_body: A consortium of Reliance Industries Limited and Apollo Global Management has made a binding offer for Walgreen Boots Alliance's international arm, Bloomberg reported. The joint proposal values the drugstore chain at over $6.3 billion. Walgreens has been seeking a valuation of about $8.8 billion for Boots, which runs a network of over 2,200 stores across the UK.

49.title: 2 youths arrested in Goa for 'inducing' girls to send private pics on social media
49.article_body: Quepem Police in Goa arrested two youths on charges of "inducing" young girls on social media to allegedly send private pictures. "The youth(s)…have been arrested under Section 151 of the Criminal Procedure Code as a preventive measure," a police inspector said. He added that the arrests were made to caution parents about social media and its use by their children.

50.title: Millions may starve due to Russia's blockade of Ukrainian ports: Zelenskyy
50.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said millions could starve due to Russia's blockade of Ukraine's Black Sea ports. Zelenskyy said the blockade has left the world "on the brink of a terrible food crisis", adding that Ukraine is now unable to export wheat, corn, vegetable oil, and other products that had played a "stabilising role in the global market."

51.title: LIC share price touches all-time low of ₹720; down 24% from IPO price
51.article_body: Shares of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) touched their all-time low price of ₹720.10 on Thursday, falling 24.12% from its IPO issue price of ₹949. LIC's share price settled 2.23% lower on Thursday at ₹721.60. Due to the fall in share price, LIC's market capitalisation has fallen to ₹4.57 lakh crore against over ₹6 lakh crore at the issue price.

52.title: Pic of teen girl dressed in a ball gown outside her bombed school in Ukraine goes viral
52.article_body: A picture of a Ukrainian teenager dressed in a ball gown outside her school, which was completely destroyed after Russian invasion, is going viral. "My niece was supposed to graduate this year from her high school. She and her friends bought dresses...Then Russians came...Today she came back to what's left of her school and her plans," a woman said.

53.title: MSP of Kharif crops for 2022-23 inadequate, below inflation rate: Cong
53.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala on Thursday alleged that the minimum support price (MSP) of Kharif crops announced for 2022-23 is "meagre and far below the rate of inflation". The Congress leader said this while comparing Kharif MSP increase with projected inflation. "Far from increasing...income of the farmer, the pain of the farmer has increased a hundred times," Surjewala said.

54.title: MobiKwik plans to raise $100 million after delaying IPO
54.article_body: Fintech startup MobiKwik is in talks with investors to raise $100 million after deferring its initial public offering (IPO), Co-founder Upasana Taku said in an interview.  However, the valuation of the startup for the funding round is not decided yet. MobiKwik is still planning to go ahead with the IPO at an opportune time, Taku added.

55.title: Microplastics found in freshly fallen Antarctic snow for the first time
55.article_body: Scientists have found microplastics in freshly fallen Antarctic snow for the first time. "We collected snow samples from 19 sites across Ross Island region of Antarctica and found microplastics in all of these," said University of Canterbury PhD student, Alex Aves. There were 13 different types of plastic found, with the most common being PET, mostly used in soft-drink bottles.

56.title: Farcical theatre of absurdity: AAP’s Raghav Chadha on Punjab Cong's protest
56.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Thursday said a "farcical theatre of absurdity" is on display by the Punjab Congress. His statement came after several Congress leaders protested outside Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann’s official residence today and later got detained. They were reportedly protesting over singer Sidhu Moosewala’s murder as well as the arrest of former Punjab minister Sadhu Singh Dharamsot.

57.title: Babar Azam gives his Player of the Match award to Khushdil Shah, gesture goes viral
57.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam gave his Player of the Match award to Khushdil Shah following the first ODI against West Indies, with his gesture going viral on social media. Babar was named Man of the Match for scoring 103(107). However, he announced that he wants to give the award to Khushdil, who scored 41*(23), helping Pakistan chase down 306-run target.

58.title: Bezos-backed Indonesian startup Lummo fires 50-60 workers in India: Report
58.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos-backed Indonesian startup Lummo has fired 50-60 employees in Bengaluru on June 7, media reports said. Employees with engineering and product roles were mostly laid off. This comes days after the startup fired 100-120 employees in Jakarta. An employee said the reason behind the layoffs wasn't clear and was around role restructuring and cost-cutting, among other things.

59.title: Girl's family sets her 2 alleged rapists on fire in Jharkhand, 1 dies
59.article_body: A girl's family and other villagers in Jharkhand set two boys on fire for allegedly raping her. One of them died in the incident. "A girl was dropped at her home by two accused allegedly after raping her...Enraged over the allegation of rape...(girl's) family members and...few other villagers brought the two boys from home...and set them on fire," police said.

60.title: Monkeypox-infected US man escapes Mexican hospital, leaves country
60.article_body: A 48-year-old American citizen infected with monkeypox escaped from a hospital in Mexico and flew back to the US. The man, suffering from symptoms like cough and pustule-like lesions on body, fled despite being told to get tested for monkeypox. The US CDC confirmed his return and said that he tested positive for the disease.

61.title: How is the President of India elected?
61.article_body: President is elected through an electoral college system in which elected MPs and MLAs from states/UTs cast votes. While the value of votes of every MP is fixed, value of MLAs' votes differ based on their states' population. The votes are given on ballot paper in order of preferences for the candidates, least-voted of whom get eliminated one by one.

62.title: Coach is not behaving well, I am very uncomfortable with him: Top Indian woman sailor
62.article_body: A top Indian woman sailor complained to Sports Authority of India (SAI) that a coach isn't behaving well with her in Germany, where they're training. "I'm very uncomfortable with him. I've complained before the federation few times," she wrote. She has urged SAI to change their coach. Earlier, a top Indian cyclist had accused her coach of inappropriate behaviour.

63.title: Was advised to get injections costing ₹9000 for fair skin: Esha Gupta
63.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta said she was "advised" to get injections for fair skin, adding she got "carried away" for some time. "I...found out that such an injection would cost ₹9000," stated Esha. "At the starting of my career, I was advised to get my nose sharpened," said Esha. "I would never want my daughter to become an actor," she added.

64.title: J&K LG Manoj Sinha orders probe into recruitment of police sub-inspectors
64.article_body: Amid reports of alleged fraud in the recruitment of police sub-inspectors in J&K, Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Thursday said the matter will be investigated. "A committee headed by additional chief secretary (home) will probe it," he said, adding that it will submit a report in time-bound manner. The recruitment will be cancelled in case of any wrongdoing, Sinha added.

65.title: Govt to begin helicopter service from Srinagar to Amarnath this year
65.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs has directed Jammu and Kashmir administration to begin helicopter service from Srinagar for Amarnath Yatra. With this, pilgrims can directly travel from Srinagar to Panchtarni, located six kilometres from the Amarnath cave, for the first time and can trek to the shrine. The decision reportedly came considering the heavy tourist rush on the Amarnath Yatra route.

66.title: J'khand man demands dowry, announces triple talaq; arrested
66.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly demanding dowry and pronouncing triple talaq against his wife in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, police said on Wednesday. The woman had registered a complaint in February this year and West Singhbhum SP Ashutosh Shekhar said that the accused was arrested on Tuesday from Chaibasa under section 498A IPC.

67.title: Delhi to get relief from heatwave June 16 onwards: IMD
67.article_body: The India Meteorological Department on Thursday said that easterly winds will bring significant relief from the heatwave in Delhi-NCR from June 16 onwards. "There is a heatwave warning for a few places in Delhi on Thursday but a steep rise in the temperature is not predicted," senior IMD scientist RK Jenamani said.

68.title: 10 people killed, 2.8 lakh evacuated due to floods in central China
68.article_body: At least 10 people have been killed and three others are missing due to floods in the central Chinese province of Hunan, state media reported. Around 18 lakh people have been affected in the mountainous province, 2.86 lakh of whom have been evacuated, Xinhua news agency said. More than 2,700 houses have been damaged or collapsed entirely due to floods.

69.title: Fire officials rescue leopard from well in Odisha using wooden ladder
69.article_body: The fire department officials in Odisha rescued a leopard that fell into a well in Sambalpur district. "We got info about it from the forest department. We went to that place and rescued the leopard with the help of a wooden ladder," an official said. A video of the incident showing the leopard climbing up the ladder has gone viral.

70.title: 3 women kill 45-day-old baby over family dispute in TN, arrested
70.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police have arrested three women for allegedly killing a 45-day-old baby in the state's Ranipet district over a family dispute. According to the police, the accused dumped the baby in a bucket filled with water, following which he drowned. The accused killed the son of her nephew after her plans to take over his house didn't materialise.

71.title: Footbridge with people on it collapses right after being inaugurated in Mexico
71.article_body: A video showing a footbridge collapsing right after being inaugurated in Mexico's Cuernavaca has surfaced on social media. The video shows local officials, including city council members, falling about 10ft on to rocks and boulders in the stream bed. The footbridge was part of a river walk along one of the city's many streams.

72.title: Frequent nightmares could be early sign of Parkinson's disease: Study
72.article_body: Older adults who start experiencing bad dreams can hint at the earliest signs of Parkinson's disease, a study stated. Researchers analysed 3,818 older men with typical brain functioning for 12 years and found people who experienced frequent nightmares were two times more likely to develop Parkinson's. Early diagnosis can help prevent symptoms like tremors, stiffness and slowness, researchers said.

73.title: 3 DTC buses catch fire at Delhi's Sunehri Pullah depot in Lodhi Colony
73.article_body: At least three Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) buses caught fire on Wednesday night at the Sunehri Pullah Bus depot in Delhi's Lodhi Colony. Notably, two Delhi Fire Service personnel sustained minor injuries when they fell into a pit while dousing the fire. "The buses caught fire due to a short circuit while parked at the battery workshop," DCP (South) said.

74.title: Sri Lanka President's brother resigns from Parliament
74.article_body: Sri Lanka's former Finance Minister and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's brother, Basil Rajapaksa on Thursday said that he has resigned from the Parliament. However, he added that he will not "step away from politics". The Sri Lankan President's elder brother, Mahinda Rajapaksa, resigned as Prime Minister last month after prolonged protests against the economic crisis in the country turned deadly.

75.title: Beauty retailer Purplle becomes India's newest unicorn after raising $33mn funding
75.article_body: Sequoia Capital-backed online beauty products marketplace Purplle has joined the unicorn club after the Mumbai-based company raised $33 million as part of its Series E funding round led by South Korea's Paramark Ventures. Existing investors Premji Invest, Blume Ventures, and Kedaara Capital also participated in the round. The company has raised $215 million to date, including this round.

76.title: Police use water cannon on Youth Cong workers protesting against Kerala CM
76.article_body: The Youth Congress workers staged a protest demanding the resignation of Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan over the gold smuggling case in Thiruvananthapuram. The police used water cannon to disperse the protestors. The protests came after the prime accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam.

77.title: Congress should support JD(S) to defeat BJP in RS polls: Kumaraswamy
77.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday said that Congress should support JD(S) in upcoming Rajya Sabha elections. "To defeat the BJP, Congress should support JD(S) which has more votes than it," Kumaraswamy tweeted while tagging Congress leader Randeep Surjewala. JD(S) has fielded Kupendra Reddy as its first candidate in the Rajya Sabha elections to be held on June 10.

78.title: 29 gram panchayats in Pune district to ban widowhood rituals
78.article_body: As many as 29 gram panchayats in the Pune district have decided to ban rituals that are associated with widowhood. Rituals including wiping of sindoor (vermilion), breaking of bangles and removal of the mangalsutra will be banned. "Khadakwasla assembly constituency will be Maharashtra's first taluka to stop these age-old rituals," Rupali Chakankar, Maharashtra women's commission Chairperson, said.

79.title: Fire breaks out at 4 scrap godowns in Mumbai, no casualties reported
79.article_body: A fire broke out at four scrap godowns in Mandala locality in Mankhurd area of Mumbai. As per the fire department,  three fire engines and two water tankers were rushed to the spot to contain the fire. The fire has been contained and no casualties were reported in the incident, the police said.

80.title: Chinese fighter jet crashes into buildings; 1 killed
80.article_body: One person was killed and at least two were injured after a Chinese J-7 fighter jet crashed into buildings in China's Hubei province on Thursday. The crash triggered a blaze that engulfed nearby houses. The pilot had safely ejected before the crash. Videos showing flames and smoke billowing from the crash site have surfaced.

81.title: Pending FIR no reason to assume accused will commit crime in future: HC
81.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to two accused persons and ruled that a pending FIR cannot be a reason to assume that the accused will commit a crime in future. The accused were arrested under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985. Around 3 kilograms of opium was recovered from the car they were travelling in.

82.title: People wrote sh*t about me: Jennifer on separation from Karan Singh Grover
82.article_body: Actress Jennifer Winget, who was earlier married to Karan Singh Grover, spoke about her separation from him. She said, "My separation was out in...public, and I wasn't...on social media. People were writing a lot of sh*t about him and me." "That period was...stressful. I was lost and didn't know what was happening. I went back into my shell," she added.

83.title: I am the biggest example of how language doesn't matter: Tamannaah
83.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia said she is the biggest recent example of how language doesn't matter. "I am a Sindhi girl...I speak Tamil and Telugu and a large part of my career has been spent in the South," added Tamannaah. "I never wanted to be a part of the South Indian film industry or the North Indian film industry," stated Tamannaah.

84.title: Actor Shivarajkumar to feature in Rajinikanth's 'Thalaivar 169'
84.article_body: Kannada actor Shivarajkumar has been cast alongside actor Rajinikanth in the upcoming film which is tentatively titled 'Thalaivar 169'. Speaking about it, Shivarajkumar said, "It's a great opportunity for anybody to act along with Rajinikanth...I'm glad...this project has made it possible for me." "He knows me from my childhood...I share a special bond with the senior actor," he added.

85.title: 5 injured, roofs damaged as controlled blast goes awry in Pune
85.article_body: The controlled blasting activity carried out during digging of a well in Pune went awry as five people were injured and the roofs of some houses were damaged, police said. The activity was carried out near a river in Wadgaon Sheri area. "During the activity, some rocks shattered and fell on the tin roofs of some...houses," a police official said.

86.title: Temple vandalised in Pakistan; idols of deities damaged
86.article_body: A temple has been vandalised and idols of deities have been damaged by miscreants in Pakistan's Karachi. "Five to six unknown suspects entered the temple and escaped after vandalising it," a Pakistani police officer said, adding that a case was being registered. "We don't know who has attacked and why," a resident of the area said.

87.title: 1 dead, 15 injured after speeding bus hits truck in MP's Khandwa
87.article_body: A truck driver died while 15 passengers of a bus were injured when the two vehicles collided in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa district on Thursday. According to police, the accident took place around 3 am on Indore-Ichhapur highway when the speeding bus, carrying 29 passengers, hit the truck coming from the opposite direction. Those injured were admitted to hospital, police added.

88.title: Waheeda Rehman attends Priya Dutt's art class, latter shares pics
88.article_body: Veteran actress Waheeda Rehman attended an art class organised by Sanjay Dutt's sister Priya Dutt. Priya, taking to Instagram, shared pictures of Waheeda with an artwork. "She fills the class with so much positive energy. Seeing Waheeda aunty brings back so many memories of my parents," Priya captioned the post. Several fans reacted to the pictures in the comment section.

89.title: Plea of Anil Deshmukh, Nawab Malik for 1-day bail to vote in RS polls rejected
89.article_body: A Mumbai court has turned down the bail request of arrested Nationalist Congress Party leaders Anil Deshmukh and Nawab Malik. The two had sought one-day bail to vote in Rajya Sabha elections. Deshmukh had been arrested in connection with the corruption case against him, while Malik was arrested in connection with a money laundering case.

90.title: Which states have most active COVID cases as India sees 40% jump in cases for 2nd day?
90.article_body: India on Thursday reported 7,240 new COVID-19 cases, witnessing a nearly 40% jump in cases for the second day in a row. Kerala has the most active COVID-19 cases in the country at 11,263, followed by Maharashtra with 9,806 active cases and Karnataka with 2,623 active cases. Delhi has 1,691 active COVID-19 cases while Tamil Nadu has 1,021 active cases.

91.title: How have India performed in T20I cricket against South Africa?
91.article_body: India and South Africa have played 15 T20Is against each other, out of which India have won nine and South Africa have won six. India's highest T20I total against South Africa is 203/5. South Africa's highest T20I total against India is 219/4. India's biggest T20I victory (by runs) against South Africa came in 2007, when they won by 37 runs.

92.title: 3 of a family die in landslide in Meghalaya's West Garo Hills
92.article_body: At least three members of a family died in a landslide that took place in the Gambegre area of Meghalaya's West Garo Hills district, police said. The rescue operation is underway, the West Garo Hills police added. Notably, the other two members of the family, the father and the son, survived and were taken to a hospital in critical condition.

93.title: Researchers develop gel that can repair damage after heart attack
93.article_body: Researchers have developed a biodegradable gel made of amino acid chains called peptides that can repair damage caused due to heart attack. This gel can be safely injected into heart and act as a scaffold for cells to grow new tissue. It's liquid under stress as peptides disassemble and after being injected, the peptides work to reassemble, making it solid.

94.title: Over 2,400 kg of seized drugs destroyed in Pune
94.article_body: The officials of the Pune Customs Commissionerate and Directorate of Revenue Intelligence destroyed 2,438 kg of drugs on Wednesday as part of Drug Destruction Day. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman virtually witnessed the destruction process. More than 42,000 kg of narcotics were destroyed at 14 locations across India on Drug Destruction Day.

95.title: Gurugram to get 'Happiness Food Street' with fountains, water bodies
95.article_body: An eating corner, named 'Happiness Food Street' will come up in sector 12A of Old Gurugram. The project will be developed over 4,000 square metres and will house 50 vendors, reports said. Reports added that the auction of vendor spots in the market is scheduled for June 16. The market will reportedly also be landscaped with fountains and water bodies.

96.title: Specially-abled Pune residents can avail PMPML's 'free pass' benefits
96.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) announced on Thursday that specially-abled persons, freedom fighters and those who have received honours from the central and state governments can avail the benefits of PMPML's 'Free Bus Pass Yojana'. The honours include 'President's Medal' and 'Bravery Medal', among other commendations. The last date to register for the scheme is June 30, PMC added.

97.title: Famous Pakistani TV host Aamir Liaquat passes away; was found unconscious at home
97.article_body: Famous Pakistani television show host Aamir Liaquat has passed away in Karachi at the age of 49. The former Member of National Assembly was reportedly found unconscious at his home and was shifted to a private hospital in a critical condition. The post-mortem examination of Liaquat will be conducted at the Jinnah Postgraduate Medical Centre.

98.title: Meta halts development of smartwatch with dual cameras: Report
98.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has halted the development of a smartwatch with dual cameras and is instead working on other devices for the wrist, Bloomberg reported. While one camera was located below the smartwatch's display, another was placed on the backside against the wearer's wrist. The smartwatch was originally targeted for release in 2023 at a cost of around $349.

99.title: Congress leaders protest near Punjab CM's house; detained
99.article_body: Several Congress leaders protesting outside Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's official residence in Chandigarh were detained on Thursday. They were reportedly protesting over singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder as well as the arrest of former Punjab minister Sadhu Singh Dharamsot on corruption charges. They alleged that the CM did not meet them despite a confirmed appointment.

100.title: Election for next President of India to be held on July 18
100.article_body: The election for next President of India will be held on July 18, ECI has said. The electoral college for the Presidential election consists of the 776 MPs of the Lok Sabha (543) and Rajya Sabha (233), as well as MLAs of state Assemblies and UTs of Delhi and Puducherry. President Ram Nath Kovind's term is ending on July 24.

101.title: Heavy rainfall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
101.article_body: The IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, West Bengal, Sikkim, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura during next 5 days. Isolated heavy rainfall is likely in Karnataka, Kerala and Puducherry between June 9 and 13. Isolated heavy rainfall is predicted over Goa on June 10 and 13 and very heavy rainfall on June 11-12.

102.title: Vignesh, Nayanthara's love story themed water bottles served at wedding: Report
102.article_body: Water bottles with pictures from stages of filmmaker Vignesh Shivan and actress Nayanthara's love story were served at their wedding, reports said. Reports added that along with the pictures, the bottles also had a branding of their production house 'Rowdy Pictures'. The two got married in Chennai on Thursday. Several celebrities, including actors Shah Rukh Khan and Rajinikanth were seen.

103.title: He loved the concept: Ayan after sharing Big B's look from Brahmāstra
103.article_body: 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji shared Amitabh Bachchan's first look from the film on Instagram. Along with the look, Ayan wrote, "GURU (and his Prabhāstra - The Sword of Light)." He added, "Since my first meeting with Mr Bachchan in 2016 to discuss Brahmāstra, he has always said...he loved the concept of this venture." The film also features Ranbir Kapoor.

104.title: Janhvi, Sara & Ananya to make a cameo in Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani: Reports
104.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor, Sara Ali Khan and Ananya Panday will reportedly have a cameo in 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. According to reports, they'll be a part of a dance number in the film. 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' also stars Dharmendra, Jaya Bachchan, Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt in pivotal roles. It's slated to release in February, 2023.

105.title: Content marketplace Pepper Content raises $14 mn for US expansion
105.article_body: Pepper Content has raised $14.3 million in a funding round led by Bessemer Venture Partners as the startup looks to bolster its presence in the US. The financing round also saw participation from investors like OYO CEO Ritesh Agarwal and CRED Founder Kunal Shah. Started in 2017, Pepper Content helps firms create content through its network of freelance content creators.

106.title: Pune's SPPU amongst top 550 in new QS World University Rankings
106.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has jumped 50 points in latest QS World University Rankings and is now among top 550 universities, according to the list. "This advancement in ranking has made our claim for...'Institute of Eminence' even stronger," Dr Prafulla Pawar, SPPU's Registrar, said. As many as 1,422 institutes globally, including 41 from India, were evaluated this time.

107.title: Actress Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan get married, share photo
107.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan got married on Thursday in Mahabalipuram. The couple shared the first photo from their wedding ceremony. "On a scale of 10...She's Nayan & I'm the One. With God's grace, the universe, the blessings of our parents & best of friends...Just married #Nayanthara," Vignesh tweeted. Actors including Rajinikanth and Shah Rukh Khan attended their wedding.

108.title: Radio signal coming from another galaxy detected by scientists
108.article_body: Astronomers have detected a radio signal coming from a galaxy believed to be nearly 3 billion light-years away. A new paper, published in Nature journal, notes that the source of the new Fast Radio Burst is "co-located with a compact, persistent radio source and associated with...a dwarf host galaxy". It was spotted in 2019 by the telescope in China's Guizhou.

109.title: Tiger & Akshay's 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' to be shot in Europe: Report
109.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' will reportedly be shot in Europe. A source stated Ali Abbas Zafar is working to give finishing touches to the script over the last two months and will be going on a "location hunt". "Ali's planning to shoot...action scenes with Akshay and Tiger at real locations in Europe," the source added.

110.title: Russia still feels too strong to negotiate: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
110.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia is unwilling to negotiate an end to the war because it still feels strong. "We need to weaken Russia and the world is supposed to do it," Zelenskyy told US corporate leaders on Wednesday via video link. Ukraine is willing to negotiate with Russia but "not at the expense of our independence", he added.

111.title: BJP will be responsible if anything happens: Raut on Al-Qaeda’s threat
111.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said BJP will be responsible if anything happens in the country, after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, UP and Gujarat. “Everything was fine in the country but the (former) spokesperson of BJP wanted fights to break out between people of two different religious communities,” Raut added.

112.title: CM busy in farmhouse, transfer Hyderabad gang-rape case to CBI: BJP
112.article_body: Telangana BJP in-charge Tarun Chugh on Wednesday reiterated party's demand to transfer the Hyderabad gang-rape case to CBI. "CM is busy in...farmhouse," Chugh said while accusing CM K Chandrashekar Rao of not being able to do justice to the victim. He further alleged that a "jungle raj" is going on in the state with law and order being compromised.

113.title: PMC to soon reserve parking in all commercial spaces for EVs
113.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) electric vehicle (EV) cell is all set to reserve a certain percentage of the parking locations in new and existing commercial buildings for EVs, a civic officer said. The EV cell has also reached a consensus on mandating additional electricity load for provision of EV charging stations in all new residential buildings starting July 1.

114.title: Nayanthara, Vignesh to feed 1.18 lakh people on wedding day: Reports
114.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan are reportedly hosting lunch for 1.18 lakh people, including 18,000 kids, across Tamil Nadu today to celebrate their wedding which took place today. Actors like Rajinikanth, Shah Rukh Khan attended the wedding. Shah Rukh and Nayanthara will be seen together in their upcoming film 'Jawan' which is expected to release on June 2, 2023.

115.title: 19-year-old kills self after failing higher secondary exam in Pune
115.article_body: A 19-year-old student in Pune allegedly died by suicide after he got to know that he had failed the Higher Secondary Certificate examination. Another 30-year-old man was injured in the incident, police said. The student lived in Kothrud and studied at a prominent college in Karve Road. While his father is a cook, his mother works as a househelp.

116.title: B'luru Airport unveils '080 International & Domestic Lounge' for passengers
116.article_body: Bangalore International Airport Limited unveiled '080 International and Domestic Lounge' at the Kempegowda International Airport. An official statement said, "The luxurious world-class lounges strongly establish Bengaluru Airport's connection and dedication to city...Designed meticulously to meet the unique requirements of every passenger, 080 is set to leave lasting impression...in their minds."

117.title: Over 1,000 monkeypox cases reported in 29 countries; list released
117.article_body: WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Wednesday said that over 1,000 monkeypox cases have been reported from 29 countries where the disease is not endemic, with no deaths reported so far in these countries. The US' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has released a list of 29 countries with confirmed monkeypox and orthopoxvirus cases till June 8.

118.title: 5 minors accused of gangraping 17-yr-old girl in Hyd should be tried as adults: Police
118.article_body: Hyderabad Police have said that they will push for five minors accused of gangraping a 17-year-old girl to be tried as adults. Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said the police will seek this in court to ensure "maximum punishment" to the accused. The girl was allegedly gangraped inside a car while returning from a birthday party last month.

119.title: I have not even achieved 5% of what he has done: Hardik on Kapil Dev
119.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev is the greatest cricketer of all time, adding that he hasn't achieved even five percent of what Kapil achieved. "The kind of impact that he had…from bowling to batting, fielding, yeah, the comparisons end from my side," added Hardik. "It is still up to people," stated Hardik.

120.title: Rajnath Singh hands over 12 high-speed boats to Vietnam
120.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh transferred 12 high-speed guard boats to Vietnam on Thursday. They were given as part of a $100 million line of credit India had pledged. The first five boats were built in India, while the rest in Vietnam. "This project is a shining example of our 'Make in India and Make for the World' mission," said Singh.

121.title: Will push for 5 minors to be tried as adults in Hyd rape case: Police
121.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand has said that the police will push for the five minors arrested in the Hyderabad gang-rape case to be treated as adults "for maximum punishment". This is permitted after a 2015 amendment to the Juvenile Justice Act for those aged 16-18 accused of a "heinous offence". Of the six accused arrested, only one is major.

122.title: 6 women labourers injured in lightning strikes in Assam's Biswanath
122.article_body: At least six women labourers were injured after lightning struck them in Assam's Biswanath district on Wednesday. The women were tea garden labourers and were plucking leaves in the garden when the lightning struck them. They are undergoing treatment at a hospital. In April this year, 18 people died due to lightning and storms in Assam.

123.title: Government's response on Prophet remark row not enough: Hamid Ansari
123.article_body: The government's response on the Prophet remark row is "not enough", former Vice-President Mohammad Hamid Ansari said. "This should have been dealt with at an appropriate political level...PM Modi could have diffused it...no one thought it fit to do this at an appropriate time," he added. Over 15 Islamic nations condemned former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

124.title: Country faced embarrassment due to BJP: CM Thackeray on Prophet remark row
124.article_body: While addressing a public rally in Aurangabad, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that the country faced embarrassment due to BJP over the remarks made by their now-suspended spokesperson Nupur Sharma against Prophet Muhammad. "We had to kneel in front of the Middle East countries...Why should the country apologise when BJP is responsible for this incident?" Thackeray said.

125.title: Muslim fakirs threatened in UP, made to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'
125.article_body: In a video that has surfaced online, three Muslim fakirs (religious men) can be seen being threatened by some locals. The incident reportedly happened in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda. In the video, a man can be seen slapping one of the fakirs and making them apologise. The man can also be seen asking the fakirs to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'.

126.title: NCP names Eknath Khadse for Maharashtra Legislative Council polls
126.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Thursday named Eknath Khadse for the upcoming elections to 10 seats of the Maharashtra Legislative Council. Khadse, who is facing an Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe in the MIDC land deal, had quit BJP in October 2020. "The BJP ignored me but NCP chief Sharad Pawar has shown confidence in me," Khadse said.

127.title: I'm doing much better: Nick Jonas on his softball injury
127.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas, speaking about his softball injury, said he's doing much better. This comes after a video of Nick limping into an emergency room in California went viral on social media. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user wrote, "It is so wrong to film this......hope he's okay!" Nick replied, "Yeah it is for sure...but I'm doing much better!"

128.title: JD(S) shifts MLAs to Bengaluru resort ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
128.article_body: In a bid to avoid poaching ahead of Rajya Sabha elections, Janata Dal (Secular) has shifted its MLAs to a resort in Bengaluru. "It is a routine practice as we will have a JDLP [JDS Legislature Party] meeting this [Thursday] evening and people [legislators] who have come from different places will stay back there," said JD(S) leader BM Farooq.

129.title: Fire near Shah Masjid in Delhi, 7 fire tenders rushed; 20 people rescued
129.article_body: A fire broke out near Shah Masjid, Batla House in the Jamia Nagar area of Delhi, news agency ANI reported. According to the Delhi Fire Service, seven fire tenders were rushed to the fire site. Delhi Fire Service also added that 20 people have been rescued so far and that the fire is under control.

130.title: Bihar CM’s good governance claim intact: Kishor as parents beg for son's body
130.article_body: After the parents of a youth in Bihar were seen begging to collect money to get the mortal remains of their son from a hospital, political strategist Prashant Kishor said humanity is ashamed. "Yet, Nitish Kumar’s claim of good governance is intact," Kishor tweeted. A hospital employee allegedly asked the parents for ₹50,000 to release the body.

131.title: Mumbai record biggest-ever victory in history of first-class cricket
131.article_body: Mumbai defeated Uttarakhand by 725 runs in Ranji Trophy 2021-22 quarter-final to record the biggest-ever victory (by runs) in the history of first-class cricket. The previous biggest victory (by runs) in first-class cricket was recorded in January 1930, when New South Wales defeated Queensland by 685 runs. Mumbai will now face Uttar Pradesh in the semi-final.

132.title: Delhi records 500+ COVID cases after 18 days, highest in 24 days
132.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday recorded over 500 fresh COVID-19 cases after a span of 18 days. With 564 new COVID-19 cases, the tally is highest in 24 days. Reports said that the positivity rate stood at 2.84 per cent on Wednesday. "There are likely to be such...ups and downs in cases throughout year...there is no need to panic," a doctor said.

133.title: Have seen days when I walked into producers' room, my phone was broken: Anud
133.article_body: Actor Anud Singh Dhaka, who will be seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari', said that he has said no to work and money in the past. "I have seen days when I had to walk into the room of producers or influential people, and my phone was broken...I don't have producers queuing up behind me," he added.

134.title: 7 killed, 41 injured in suspected arson in South Korea building
134.article_body: At least seven people were killed and 41 others injured after a fire, which resulted from suspected arson, broke out in a seven-floor office building in South Korea's Daegu city. The police said that in the security camera footage, the suspect was seen leaving his home holding an apparent container that may have been used for arson.

135.title: Russian mountaineer unfurls Ukraine flag on Mt Everest in protest against war
135.article_body: A Russian mountaineer and blogger unfurled the Ukrainian flag on top of world's highest peak, Mount Everest, in protest against her country's war in Ukraine. Katya Lipka shared the picture of the moment on Instagram on June 3. Lipka achieved the feat on May 24, three months after Russia invaded Ukraine.

136.title: Used to live in a house as big as a carpet in my current home: Farah
136.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan said she used to live in a house which was as big as a certain carpet in her current residence. "Our fridge had conked off for years...We used to take a tapeli of water and give it to...our neighbour. She...[would] keep it in the fridge. It would turn into ice and then we'd break it," added Farah.

137.title: Thailand decriminalises marijuana, govt says for medical use only
137.article_body: Thailand became the first Asian country to decriminalise cultivation and possession of marijuana on Thursday. The government is promoting cannabis for medical use. Speaking in favour of cannabis recently, Health Minister Anutin Charnvirakul had said, "We should know how to use cannabis." "If we have the right awareness, cannabis is like gold, something valuable and should be promoted," he added.

138.title: 6, including 2 women, held for assaulting traffic personnel in Delhi
138.article_body: At least six persons, including two women, were arrested for allegedly assaulting a traffic police personnel in Delhi's Tigri, police said. The incident took place when the traffic personnel was issuing challan to a man for triple riding when he and his sisters allegedly attacked him. One of the women claimed that the inspector slapped her.

139.title: Tesla proceeds with online hiring event in China, adds new job postings
139.article_body: Tesla will be holding an online hiring event in China today and has added two dozen new job postings for the country. It'll be recruiting staff for "smart manufacturing" roles. The firm currently has 224 openings for managers and engineers under that category. This comes after Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the firm needs to cut staff by around 10%.

140.title: Sri Lanka hit by power cuts after key union goes on strike
140.article_body: Many parts of Sri Lanka were hit by power cuts on Thursday after a power sector union went on an indefinite strike. The union is opposing the government's plan to amend legislation governing the nation's power sector, including removing curbs on competitive bidding for renewable power projects. On Wednesday, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa declared electricity supply an essential service.

141.title: K'taka teacher shares private photos of girl student on WhatsApp; booked
141.article_body: A 44-year-old physical education teacher in Karnataka has been booked for allegedly sharing private pictures of a girl student on WhatsApp. The accused reportedly exploited the girl sexually after promising her that he would marry her. He also took pictures of their private moments and shared them on WhatsApp status after her family fixed her marriage with another person.

142.title: India's bio-economy has grown 8 times in last 8 years: PM
142.article_body: India's bio-economy has grown eight times in the last eight years, PM Narendra Modi said on Thursday. "India is not too far from joining the league of top ten countries in the biotech global ecosystem," he added. Furthermore, he said that more than 5,000 start-ups are associated with the biotech sector.

143.title: Rafael Nadal has been living with pain since 2005: Ex-coach Toni
143.article_body: Rafael Nadal's uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said Rafael has been living with pain since the last 17 years. "If there is a shred of hope...he keeps trying. That's his sporting greatness," added Toni. "It is incredible that my limping nephew continues to win. Fighting to the end is in his DNA," stated Toni. Rafael recently won French Open 2022.

144.title: 11-yr-old B'luru boy kidnapped for ₹50 lakh ransom rescued within 9 hours
144.article_body: Bengaluru Police rescued an 11-year-old boy kidnapped for a ransom of ₹50 lakh within nine hours. The son of a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation driver Subhash was kidnapped from outside his home in Horamavu at around 5.30 pm on Tuesday by an unknown woman. He was held captive at a farmhouse, where the woman's brother-in-law worked as a security guard.

145.title: Sickness is getting worse: Justin Bieber after postponing tour dates
145.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber has postponed the dates of his upcoming North American Justice tour. "Can't believe I'm saying this. I've done everything to get better, but my sickness is getting worse," Justin wrote on his Instagram Stories. The tour was scheduled to begin on June 7 at Scotiabank Arena in Toronto. "I'm gonna rest and get better," he concluded.

146.title: 3 arrested for murdering 22-yr-old grocery shop owner in Gurugram
146.article_body: Police arrested three people for allegedly murdering a 22-year-old grocery shop owner on Gurugram's Kundli-Manesar-Palwal Expressway after stealing his valuables on Wednesday. The accused had been involved in several robberies across Manesar in recent months, police said. The deceased told them to spare his life and take away what they wanted, said his fiancee, who was on call with him.

147.title: Rupee hits all-time low of 77.81 against US dollar
147.article_body: The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of 77.81 against the US dollar on Thursday. It had recorded the previous all-time low of 77.7975 on May 17. This comes amid sustained foreign capital outflows and elevated global crude oil prices. The Indian rupee had opened at 77.74 at the interbank foreign exchange on Thursday.

148.title: Kangana shares pics of her new mountain-style home in Manali made of river stone
148.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram to share pictures of her new home in Manali. "I built a new home...it’s an extension of my existing house in Manali, but this time kept it authentic, typically mountain style made of river stone, local slates and wood," she wrote. She added, "I've also incorporated Himachali paintings, weaves, rugs, embroideries and wooden karigiri."

149.title: Owaisi, Yati Narsinghanand named in Delhi Police FIR over 'inflammatory remarks'
149.article_body: Delhi Police have named AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand in an FIR registered over alleged inflammatory remarks, ANI reported. This comes after Delhi Police registered cases against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, expelled head of Delhi BJP's media unit Naveen Kumar Jindal and journalist Saba Naqvi for allegedly spreading hate.

150.title: Sena MP Priyanka to visit J&K to meet deceased Kashmiri pandits' families
150.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi will visit Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday to meet the relatives of Kashmiri Pandits killed recently. She is also expected to meet the family of government employee Rahul Bhat who was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam. Chaturvedi had earlier written to Home Minister Amit Shah seeking security for Hindu community in Kashmir.

151.title: 24-yr-old from Gujarat marries herself ahead of scheduled date; shares pics
151.article_body: Kshama Bindu from Gujarat has married herself ahead of the scheduled date after a BJP leader opposed her wedding and said she wouldn't be allowed to marry in a temple. The 24-year-old, who had said that her parents are open-minded and accepting of her wedding, shared pics from her wedding, mehendi and haldi ceremonies.

152.title: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's ED custody extended till June 13
152.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has got the custody of Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain till June 13. He was taken to Rouse Avenue District Court as his ED custody ended on Thursday. The ED  had earlier also raided Jain's residence in connection with the case. Jain was arrested in an alleged money laundering case on May 30.

153.title: South Africa will 100% win 1st T20I vs India if they win toss: Aakash
153.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra said South Africa will 100 percent win the first match of the five-match T20I series against India, if they win the toss. "If India [win] the toss, then also...51-49 [percent] in favour of South Africa," added Aakash. Aakash stated there isn't any bowler in India's team for the series barring Yuzvendra Chahal who troubles Quinton De Kock.

154.title: Govt’s efforts to force peace in J&K failed miserably: Farooq Abdullah
154.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said that the government's efforts to "force peace" in Jammu and Kashmir have failed "miserably". "We are facing an alarming situation that has arisen out of the August 5, 2019, undemocratic and unconstitutional decisions," Abdullah added. "Now, they are struggling with their failures. Neither there is peace nor any visage of development here," he stated.

155.title: Poster asking shops to remain shut on June 10 surfaces in Unnao, probe on
155.article_body: Police launched a probe after a poster making an appeal to keep shops closed on June 10, Friday, surfaced in UP’s Unnao district. The poster was put up in the Sadar Kotwali area, ASP, Shashi Shekhar Singh, said. The poster seemed to be the handiwork of some mischievous elements and the police have removed it, the officer added.

156.title: Mexican megachurch leader jailed in US for child sexual abuse
156.article_body: The leader of a Mexico-based megachurch that claims to have around 5 million followers worldwide has been sentenced to 16 years and eight months in a California jail for sexually abusing young girls. Naason Garcia last week had pleaded guilty to two counts of forcible oral copulation involving minors and performing a lewd act on a child.

157.title: 'The Gray Man' is Dhanush's 1st H'wood film, he's fantastic: Joe Russo
157.article_body: ‘The Gray Man’ co-director Anthony Russo has said, “The cast is dynamite in this movie...there’s a lot of places to go other than those two guys [Chris Evans and Ryan Gosling] up front.” When asked if this was Dhanush’s first Hollywood film, Joe Russo replied, “Yes, this is Dhanush’s first Hollywood film. He’s fantastic.”

158.title: What happened to Shah Rukh was witch-hunt for backing TMC: Naseeruddin on Aryan case
158.article_body: Naseeruddin Shah has suggested that Aryan Khan was arrested in a drug case because Shah Rukh Khan supported West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's party. Naseeruddin Shah said, "What happened to Shah Rukh Khan and the dignity with which he faced it was admirable. It was nothing but a witch-hunt. All he did was support Trinamool and applaud Mamata Banerjee's victory."

159.title: 10 more victims of Delhi's Mundka fire tragedy identified
159.article_body: Ten more bodies of Mundka fire victims have been identified by the forensic teams through DNA matching, officials said on Thursday. With this, 20 of the 27 people, who died in the massive fire at a commercial building in Outer Delhi's Mundka, have been identified. The remaining seven bodies are being processed for sample extraction and testing, officials added.

160.title: Dispose of public applications in time-bound manner: UP CM to officials
160.article_body: The Chief Secretary and Director General of Police should ensure that District Magistrates (DMs)/Superintendents of Police (SPs) are sensitive to the disposal of public grievances, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "Public applications should be disposed of in a time-bound manner. DMs and SPs should interact with local public representatives and take guidance from them on public issues," UP CM added.

161.title: Don't know how they explain it to their conscience: Naseeruddin on Khans' silence
161.article_body: Naseeruddin Shah has spoken on the silence of Bollywood's Khans on political matters, saying, "I feel they think they would be risking too much. But then, I don't know how they explain to their own conscience about it." He added, "I cannot speak for them...I'm not in the position they are in." This comes after ex-BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet.

162.title: PM Modi inaugurates India's first Biotech Startup Expo 2022 in Delhi
162.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated India's first Biotech Startup Expo 2022 at Delhi's Pragati Maidan. "It will strengthen the Aatmanirbhar Bharat movement in the sector," he said. "India's bio-economy has grown eight times in the last eight years. India is not too far from joining the league of top ten countries in the biotech global ecosystem," PM Modi added.

163.title: BMC sub-engineer, associate arrested for taking ₹1 lakh as bribe
163.article_body: A BMC sub-engineer and his associate were arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹1 lakh. The sub-engineer, identified as Sacchidanand Kore, had reportedly demanded money through his associate in return for clearing a person's application for water connection to his plot in Malad. Following a complaint, ACB laid a trap and arrested the accused.

164.title: Armed man arrested for threatening to kill US Supreme Court Justice
164.article_body: A 26-year-old man with a pistol and a knife was arrested on Wednesday near US Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh's home after allegedly threatening to kill the judge. Nicholas Roske has been charged with the attempted murder of a Supreme Court Justice. Roske was allegedly upset over Texas school shooting and expected Supreme Court rulings on abortion and gun rights.

165.title: Actress Mahima Chaudhry reveals she had breast cancer, Anupam Kher shares video
165.article_body: In a video shared by actor Anupam Kher, actress Mahima Chaudhry revealed she had breast cancer. She said the cancer was diagnosed during an annual checkup and added she has now recovered from it. "Her attitude will give hope to so many women all over the world...She calls me an eternal optimist but dearest Mahima, 'You're my HERO!'" Anupam wrote.

166.title: Spikes spotted on Mars; NASA releases pic
166.article_body: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration has released a picture of spikes that were spotted by its Curiosity rover on Mars. Sharing the picture on Twitter, the SETI Institute said, "The spikes are most likely the cemented fillings of ancient fractures in a sedimentary rock. The rest of the rock was made of softer material and was eroded away."

167.title: All religions preach humanity: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai
167.article_body: Addressing the farewell for Haj pilgrims, Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said all religions preach humanity and appealed to them to pray for peace in the country. "One who completes Haj...becomes a Haji on return to lead...pious life. Then only the pilgrimage is considered meaningful," he said. About 450 pilgrims will leave for Haj on the first flight from Bengaluru.

168.title: Remove Punjab ADGP-Prisons, my brother Majithia not safe: Harsimrat
168.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Harsimrat Kaur Badal said she has urged the Governor of Punjab to remove IPS officer Harpreet Sidhu as ADGP-Prisons saying that there is a threat to former minister Bikram Singh Majithia's life. "He [Sidhu] has been given this post to allow him to settle his personal scores with the former state minister," she added.

169.title: India's playing XI in last 4 or 5 ICC events didn't make sense: Manjrekar
169.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said the kind of playing XI picked by India in the last four or five ICC events did not make sense, adding that they overthought the whole process. "That...hurt India," stated Manjrekar. "The one thing you expect [India head coach] Rahul Dravid to do really well is team selection, picking the right XI," said Manjrekar.

170.title: Nadal is above Muhammad Ali, Pelé, Jordan: Ex-French Open director
170.article_body: Ex-French Open director Guy Forget said he considers Rafael Nadal "above" late boxing legend Muhammad Ali, Brazilian football legend Pelé and NBA legend Michael Jordan. "Nadal has achieved the greatest feat in the...history of sport...[He] has won Roland-Garros 14 times. It is unimaginable," added Forget. "It surprises everyone...and the best part is...it is an ongoing series," he stated.

171.title: Excited to see you walking up the aisle: Vignesh to Nayanthara
171.article_body: Taking to Instagram, filmmaker Vignesh Shivan penned a note for Nayanthara on Thursday ahead of their wedding. Vignesh shared pictures with the actress and wrote, "I owe it all to the good manifestations and prayers! Now, it's all dedicated to the love of my life." He added, "Nayanthara...Excited to see you walking up the aisle in a few hours!"

172.title: J&K's Kulgam school to be named after teacher killed by terrorists
172.article_body: The government high school of Gopalpora in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam will be renamed after Rajni Bala, the teacher who was shot dead by terrorists days ago. Announcing the decision, J&K LG Manoj Sinha said, "I met her [Bala's] family members and all their demands and concerns will be resolved on a priority basis."

173.title: 3 brothers among 5 dead after inhaling toxic gas in well in MP
173.article_body: At least five persons, including three brothers, died on Wednesday after allegedly inhaling suspected toxic gas inside a well in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district, police said. Initially, two persons entered the well to clean it and when they did not come out for long, well owner and three others climbed down to see what was wrong, police added.

174.title: Doctor falls from 7th floor of AIIMS building in Assam, dies
174.article_body: A doctor reportedly died after falling from seventh floor of the under-construction All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Assam's Kamrup on Wednesday.
