Starc had slit the index finger of his bowling hand on his shoe spike during the first over of the first T20I. He completed his overs despite the injury, recording figures of 3/26 as Australia won by 10 wickets.

349.title: Central Bank Digital Currency will be introduced this fiscal: RBI
349.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Wednesday said the Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC), also known as digital rupee, will be introduced in fiscal year 2022-23. Process of introduction of CBDC will be gradual to avoid any impact on the financial and banking system, Sankar added. Introduction of CBDC was announced in Union Budget 2022.

350.title: NCPCR summons Alappuzha SP over child raising hate slogans at PFI rally
350.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has summoned Alappuzha SP over a minor child who was allegedly seen raising provocative slogans at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala. The NCPCR has also sought detailed action taken report from the police by June 14. The commission had earlier sought registration of FIR against those responsible.

351.title: Raj Cong MLA accuses BJP, Subhash Chandra of horse-trading; seeks FIR
351.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Mahendra Choudhary sought an FIR against BJP leaders, including state BJP president Satish Poonia, and independent candidate Subhash Chandra for alleged horse-trading attempts ahead of Rajya Sabha polls. BJP and Chandra are trying to win by misusing central agencies like ED, Choudhary alleged. This comes after Chandra claimed that eight MLAs will cross vote in his favour.

352.title: India could be $20 trillion economy by 2040, says Chief Economic Advisor
352.article_body: If the dollar GDP doubles every seven years, India will be at $20 trillion GDP by 2040 with per capita income close to $15,000, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said. "India is forecasted by IMF to cross $5 trillion by 2026-27," he stated. "Indian economy is...[in] much better place than many others in the world to face...challenges," Nageswaran added.

353.title: Julia Garner offered role of Madonna in singer's biopic: Report
353.article_body: Actress Julia Garner has been offered the role of Madonna in the singer's upcoming biopic, a report by Variety stated.  The report added Garner's team is expected to accept the offer for the role. "The focus of this film will always be music. Music has kept me going and art has kept me alive," Madonna stated while announcing her film.

354.title: Felt really nice meeting such a legend: Umran on his 1st training session
354.article_body: Recalling his first day of India's training session where he met head coach Rahul Dravid, pacer Umran Malik said, "I felt really nice meeting such a legend. He told me to keep continuing what I'm doing." He added, "I was really excited for the first day...Was positive that I would bowl well in the nets...Everyone here [is] like a brother."

355.title: Decayed human head found in Delhi, police say can't identify or know gender
355.article_body: A decayed human head has been found in Delhi. This comes days after decomposed body parts with missing head and torso were found in the same area. Police said immediately ascertaining the identity and gender of the deceased is not possible. Police added that the head may be of the same person whose body parts were found earlier.

356.title: Ukraine to launch 'Book of Executioners' to record Russian war crimes
356.article_body: Ukraine will launch a "Book of Executioners" next week to record war crimes committed by the Russian forces in the ongoing conflict, said President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "A special publication is to be launched - 'The Book of Executioners' - an information system to collect...data about war criminals, criminals from the Russian army," he said.

357.title: Stone pelting in Jahangirpuri, no casualties reported; 3-5 vehicles damaged
357.article_body: Stone pelting took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after two groups allegedly got into a fight on Tuesday night. Reports said that no casualties were reported but three to five vehicles were damaged. Police said that there is no communal angle to the fight and it happened as a man and his associates pelted stones and were looking for two locals.

358.title: Title of my 525th movie is finalised, it's 'The Signature': Anupam
358.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, revealed that his 525th film's name is 'The Signature'. "The name of my 525th movie is finalised. Slightly modified but mainly based on your suggestions," he added. Recently, Anupam had asked his fans to help decide the title of the film. "Thank you for helping us decide the title of our film," he stated.

359.title: Use of coal in Delhi-NCR banned from January 1, 2023 onwards
359.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) on Wednesday banned the use of coal for all purposes in Delhi-NCR from January 1, 2023 onwards. Use of coal in regions where PNG supply is available will be banned from October 1, 2022, CAQM said. Use of low-sulphur coal in thermal power plants, however, has been kept out of the ban.

360.title: Ex-US teacher pleads guilty to leading all-female ISIS battalion
360.article_body: A former US school teacher has pleaded guilty to organising and leading an all-female military battalion in Syria on behalf of ISIS.  Allison Fluke-Ekren pleaded guilty to one count of providing support to the group and admitted to training over 100 women and girls. She trained women to use AK-47 assault rifles, grenades and suicide belts, US Justice Department said.

361.title: Deepinder Goyal's ESOPs cost Zomato ₹387 cr in second half of FY22
361.article_body: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal's ESOPs cost the company ₹387 crore in the second half of the financial year ending on March 31, regulatory filings showed. Zomato incurred an expense of ₹778 crore in salaries and other benefits like ESOPs. Among the key managerial personnel, CFO Akshant Goyal's salaries and other expenses amounted to ₹50 lakh.

362.title: 11-yr-old girl among 2 dead, 20 injured as tractor-trolley overturns in UP
362.article_body: An 11-year-old girl and a 50-year-old woman were killed after a tractor-trolley overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri district. According to police, the accident occurred on Tuesday night when the driver of the tractor-trolley lost control over the vehicle and it overturned. Twenty others were injured in the accident, out of which 10 were shifted to district hospital, police added.

363.title: Woman allegedly kills husband in Pune, claims he died by suicide
363.article_body: A case has been registered against a woman who allegedly killed her 35-year-old husband and later claimed that he died by suicide at their home in Pune's Tathawade area. The couple allegedly had a fight, following which the woman attacked her husband with a hard object. She later allegedly hanged him to show it as a suicide.

364.title: Gallery collapses during football match in Kerala; many injured
364.article_body: Several people were injured after a portion of a gallery collapsed during a football match between two regional teams in Kerala's Malappuram district on Monday. The victims were taken to the district hospital in the Nilambur town and other private hospitals nearby for treatment. A similar incident of a stadium gallery collapse in Malappuram was reported in March this year.

365.title: RBI raises limit for recurring payment e-mandate to ₹15,000
365.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday raised the limit for e-mandates for recurring payments such as subscriptions, fees and EMIs from ₹5,000 to ₹15,000. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, while announcing the decision, said, "This will further leverage the benefits available under the framework and augment customer convenience." RBI also raised the repo rate by 50 basis points on Wednesday.

366.title: Political agenda: Kerala CM on involvement in gold smuggling claim
366.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan denied the allegation of his involvement in the Kerala gold smuggling case, saying it’s a part of the political agenda. His statement came after prime accused in the case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam. "There is not even an iota of facts in this allegation," Vijayan added.

367.title: Mithali Raj retires from all forms of international cricket after 23-year-long career
367.article_body: India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj announced her retirement from all forms of international cricket after a career spanning nearly 23 years. "It was an honour to have led the team for so many years...It definitely shaped me as a person," the 39-year-old wrote on social media. Mithali played 12 Tests, 232 ODIs and 89 T20Is, scoring 10,868 international runs.

368.title: If it's high-scoring game, then you want players to maintain strike rate: Dravid
368.article_body: During the virtual press conference ahead of the five-match T20I series against South Africa, Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said he expects players to maintain a strike rate in high-scoring matches in the series. "If the wicket is more challenging, then they have to respond to that as well," he added. The first T20I will be played on Thursday.

369.title: Saw many bad days at KKR, started doubting myself: Kuldeep Yadav
369.article_body: Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav said he had "many" bad days while representing his former IPL franchise KKR, adding that he started doubting himself after not getting chances. "You start thinking, 'What do I have to do? How will I get an opportunity? How will I perform?'" added Kuldeep. Kuldeep picked 21 wickets in IPL 2022 for DC.

370.title: Clear bus lanes of illegally parked private vehicles: Delhi minister
370.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot has directed officials to clear bus lanes of illegally parked private vehicles to ensure seamless traffic movement, as per an official statement. Delhi government on April 1 had started an intensive enforcement drive for buses and goods carriage vehicles. As of June 6, around 28,000 challans have been issued under the drive.

371.title: What will happen to parents who've lost their young son: Mika on Moosewala
371.article_body: Singer Mika, while talking about the death of singer Sidhu Moosewala, said that if the late singer's fans are shocked and if Mika himself is sad, what will happen to the parents who have lost their young son. "Whatever happened is wrong. It should not have happened," he said, adding that everyone should be together in such time.

372.title: Consider Marathi as optional language for UP students: Maha BJP leader to CM Yogi
372.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Kripashankar Singh requested UP CM Yogi Adityanath to consider Marathi as an optional language for the students of Secondary and Higher Secondary in UP. In a letter to UP CM, Singh wrote, "That may help students in getting better jobs in Maharashtra." "A big chunk of students…get migrated to Maharashtra for getting appropriate jobs," he added.

373.title: Democratic system will collapse in absence of police reforms: Ex-IPS officer
373.article_body: The Democratic system will collapse if police reforms are not carried out and the force continues to work under colonial model, said former Indian Police Service (IPS) officer Prakash Singh. "If you want good detection of crime...good law and order, then there is no escaping from having police reforms," said Singh, who has served as UP and Assam police chief.

374.title: All of Bengal's top 9 batters score 50+ in same first-class innings, create world record
374.article_body: All of Bengal's top nine batters scored 50-plus runs in the first innings against Jharkhand in Ranji Trophy quarter-final. This is the first time in first-class cricket history that nine players have gone past the 50-run mark in the same innings. Sudip Kumar Gharami top-scored for Bengal with 186(380) as they declared their innings on 773/7.

375.title: BJP releases candidate list for MLC polls in 3 states, KP Maurya fielded in UP
375.article_body: BJP has released a list of 16 candidates for the upcoming Legislative Council elections in three states - Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra and Bihar. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya, who lost the Assembly election from Sirathu seat, has been named in the list with eight other candidates for UP. Five candidates have been named for Maharashtra and two for Bihar.

376.title: Kejriwal mastermind of corruption: Manoj Tiwari on ED’s raid against Jain
376.article_body: After the ED found ₹2.85 crore in cash and 133 gold coins on raiding Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain and his aide's premises, BJP leader Manoj Tiwari said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is the "mastermind" of this corruption. "The way Arvind Kejriwal is defending Satyendar Jain, I believe that Kejriwal is the mastermind of this corruption," Tiwari added.

377.title: Fire breaks out at restaurant in Pune's Aundh, no casualties reported
377.article_body: A fire broke out at a restaurant located on the eighth floor of a building in the Aundh suburb of Pune on Wednesday, fire brigade officials said. The fire was reported at 5.45 am in the dining area of Sky Garage restaurant, which also houses a bar. The fire has been doused and no casualties have been reported so far.

378.title: Amber Heard responds after Johnny Depp's 'moving forward' post for his supporters
378.article_body: Amber Heard has responded after Johnny Depp's "moving forward" post on social media platforms. "As Johnny Depp says he's 'moving forward', women's rights are moving backward. The verdict's message to victims of domestic violence is...be afraid to stand up and speak out," a representative for Heard said. Depp had posted a video thanking his supporters.

379.title: Director Todd Phillips confirms sequel to 'Joker' on Instagram
379.article_body: Director Todd Phillips has confirmed a sequel to his 2019 film 'Joker'. Taking to Instagram, Todd shared the cover of the script of the sequel with the title "Joker: Folie a Deux". As per the Instagram post, the script is written by Todd and Scott Silver. Joaquin Phoenix played the lead in the 2019 film.

380.title: Congratulations for historic accomplishment: PM Modi on Avani's world record
380.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated shooter Avani Lekhara for securing the gold medal with a world record score of 250.6 in women's 10m Air Rifle Standing SH1 at the Chateauroux Para Shooting World Cup. "Congratulations Avani for this historic accomplishment. May you keep scaling newer heights of success and inspiring others," PM Modi tweeted.

381.title: Game changer: Paytm CEO on RBI move to allow linking credit cards to UPI
381.article_body: Reacting to RBI's announcement that credit cards will be allowed to be linked with UPI, Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, "This is a game changer move by RBI." He added, "Also the beginning of MDR/ Interchange of card networks starting to apply on mobile payments." Notably, linking of credit cards with UPI will begin with RuPay cards.

382.title: Norway says it donated 22 howitzers to Ukraine amid war
382.article_body: The Norwegian government on Wednesday said that it has donated as many as 22 self-propelled howitzers to Ukraine, which is at war with Russia. It said it also donated spare parts, ammunition and other gear. "The Norwegian government has waited to publicly announce the donation for security reasons. Future donations may not be announced or commented upon," it said.

383.title: Umran might play a few games but who cares about bilateral matches: Manjrekar
383.article_body: Sharing his opinion on India's upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "[Umran Malik] might play a couple of matches but bilateral matches who cares, it is about the big marquee event, the ICC events." "That's where they (selectors) will be wondering if it is...too early to rush him into that kind of a stage," added Manjrekar.

384.title: Was p*****g myself laughing between takes: Zendaya on 'No Way Home'
384.article_body: Actress Zendaya, while having a conversation with Andrew Garfield in an interview, talked about her experience of shooting 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' with Andrew, Tobey Maguire and Tom Holland. "I was p*****g myself laughing...You guys had me dying, like crying laughing in between takes all the time," she added. The duo recalled an "inside joke" about Tobey over his forearms.

385.title: BJP carrying out 'cultural atrocity' via textbook revision: Shivakumar
385.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Tuesday accused the state government of carrying out 'cultural atrocity' through its textbook revision decision. "The BJP government has resorted to the cultural atrocity by twisting many great ideas, including Kuvempu in the children's revised textbook," Shivakumar alleged. He further stated that Congress will protest against the issue on June 9.

386.title: 7 samples matched with family members' DNA in Mundka fire tragedy
386.article_body: After submitting reports to the Delhi Police, the forensic teams matched seven samples with the DNA of the family members of the missing persons in Delhi's Mundka fire tragedy. Twenty seven bodies of victims have been preserved at the Sanjay Gandhi Hospital. Blood samples of their family members were earlier sent for DNA profiling and matching.

387.title: Filled with passion, love & sincerity: Vijay Deverakonda on 'Major'
387.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Vijay Deverakonda praised Adivi Sesh's film 'Major'. "A film filled with passion, love and sincerity...Definitely watch this one to know about our hero," Vijay tweeted. "Congratulations to the entire team! And my warmest respect and love to the parents of Major Sandeep [Unnikrishnan]," he added. The film also featured Saiee Manjrekar and Sobhita Dhulipala.

388.title: Shooter Avani Lekhara wins gold with world record in Para World Cup
388.article_body: Tokyo Paralympics gold medallist Avani Lekhara won gold at the Para Shooting World Cup with a world record score of 250.6 in women’s 10m Air Rifle Standing SH1 in Chateauroux, France on Tuesday. The 20-year-old shooter broke her own world record of 249.6 to secure her a spot at the 2024 Paris Paralympics.

389.title: Accused used govt vehicle in Hyd's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case: Police
389.article_body: The accused in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case used a government vehicle to commit crime, Hyderabad City Commissioner of Police CV Anand said. "The vehicle was allotted to one of the accused's father, who is a government employee. Two vehicles were used...and were driven by minors," he added. A 17-year-old girl was gang-raped in Jubilee Hills area on May 28.

390.title: Credit cards can now be linked to UPI, starting with RuPay: RBI
390.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday announced that credit cards will now be allowed to be linked with the UPI accounts. The implementation will begin with the indigenous RuPay credit cards, followed by other card networks such as Visa and Mastercard. Until now, customers could only link their debit cards to UPI.

391.title: Kamal Haasan gifts Lexus car to 'Vikram' director, Apache bikes to 13 assistant directors
391.article_body: Following the success of 'Vikram', actor Kamal Haasan gifted a Lexus car to the film's director Lokesh Kanagaraj. He also gifted Apache RTR 160 bikes to 13 assistant directors who worked on the film. The film has crossed ₹200-crore earnings worldwide in the first five days of its release. 'Vikram' is Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide.

392.title: World Bank approves $1.49 billion in further aid to Ukraine
392.article_body: The World Bank's executive board has approved an additional fund of $1.49 billion for Ukraine amid its ongoing war with Russia. With this, the total monetary assistance it pledged to aid Ukraine crossed to over $4 billion. The latest funding was backed by countries including Britain, the Netherlands, Lithuania, Latvia and Italy.

393.title: Russia losing 300 soldiers a day: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
393.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claimed that over 31,000 Russian soldiers have lost their lives in Ukraine since the invasion began. "Since February 24, Russia has been paying almost 300 lives a day for a completely pointless war," Zelenskyy said. "And still the day will come when the number of losses, even for Russia, will exceed the permissible limit," he added.

394.title: He's Hercules, even surprises his own team: Aus Open director on Nadal
394.article_body: Australian Open director Craig Tiley said Rafael Nadal is "Hercules", adding that he even surprises his own team. "[His team is] just as surprised as the rest of us are because never did Rafa himself think that [he will win the French Open]," stated Tiley. "To...win it as convincingly as he did in the [final] is honestly remarkable," said Tiley.

395.title: Suspected cattle carcasses found in Noida dump yard; police begin probe
395.article_body: Police have launched an investigation after suspected cattle carcasses were found in a dump yard in Noida. A passerby informed the police about the carcasses at around 12:30 am on Tuesday, police said, adding that it might have been thrown on Monday night. "Four police teams have been formed to investigate...case," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Central Noida) Harish Chander.

396.title: Rahul Tripathi was the best no. 3 batter of IPL 2022: Sehwag
396.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has praised SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, terming him the "best number three batter" of IPL 2022. "If you look at all teams, if there's one player who attained most success at number three, it's Rahul Tripathi...he contributed a lot to SRH winning five matches in a row," stated Sehwag. Tripathi scored 413 runs in IPL 2022.

397.title: 17 people killed, 50 injured as train derails in Iran
397.article_body: At least 17 people have been killed and 50 others have been injured after a train derailed in Iran on Wednesday, state TV reported. Of those wounded, over 12 have sustained severe injuries, officials said. The passenger train derailed on the Tabas-Yazd line in eastern Iran. According to reports, the accident took place after the train collided with an excavator.

398.title: Problematic in hierarchal organisations: Cong leader on CDS selection pool widening
398.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari said widening the pool for selection of CDS is not necessarily a bad idea but in "strictly regimented" and "hierarchal organisations" it may be problematic to put a retired officer over serving chiefs. The Centre issued three separate notifications amending the rules of the Army, Navy and Air Force for the appointment of the next CDS.

399.title: Cancer vanishes in all 12 patients for the '1st time in history' during drug trial in US
399.article_body: Cancer vanished in all 12 patients who participated in a drug trial in US, with a doctor saying, "I believe this is the first time this has happened in history of cancer." The rectal cancer patients were given dostarlimab every three weeks for six months. Results of the trial have been published in The New England Journal of Medicine.

400.title: He fired 17 or 19 shots: Spurs' Emerson on being robbed at gunpoint
400.article_body: Sharing his experience of being robbed at gunpoint, Tottenham Hotspur defender Emerson Royal said, "When I give him what he wants...he unlocks his gun to shoot me...He starts shooting everywhere and doesn't hit anyone." "He fired 17 or 19 shots," added Emerson. "I understood that it was a moment that could cost me my life," stated Emerson.
